clause.title: Acceptable forms of construction for walls — timber and steel framing

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Acceptable forms of construction for timber and steel framing walls are set out in (2) to (11).

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Two rows of 70 x 35 mm timber studs at 450 mm centres with—

ol.li: an air gap not less than 20 mm between the rows of studs; and
75 mm thick glass or mineral wool insulation with a density of 8 kg/m³ or 60 mm thick polyester insulation with a density of 11 kg/m³ positioned between one row of studs; and
two layers of 13 mm fire-protective grade plasterboard or one layer of 6 mm fibre-cement sheet and one layer of 13 mm fire-protective grade plasterboard, fixed to outside face of studs,

subclause.p: has an Rw + Ctr of not less than 50 and an Rw of not less than 50, if constructed as shown in Figure S28C7a.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: One row of 70 mm x 35 mm staggered timber studs, without noggings between adjacent studs, at not less than 450 mm centres, fixed to 90 mm x 35 mm wall plates with—

ol.li: 75 mm thick glass or mineral wool insulation with a minimum density of 8 kg/m³ positioned between studs; and
two layers of 13 mm fire-protective grade plasterboard fixed to outside face of studs,

subclause.p: has an Rw of not less than 50, if constructed as shown in Figure S28C7b.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: One row of 70 mm x 35 mm timber studs at not less than 600 mm centres with—

ol.li: 75 mm thick glass or mineral wool insulation with a minimum density of 8 kg/m³ positioned between studs; and
two layers of 13 mm fire-protective grade plasterboard fixed to outside face of studs,

subclause.p: has an Rw of not less than 45, if constructed as shown in Figure S28C7c.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: One row of 70 mm x 35 mm timber studs at not less than 450 mm centres with—

ol.li: 28 mm furring channels installed horizontally on one side; and
two layers of 13 mm fire-protective plasterboard fixed on each face,

subclause.p: has an Rw of not less than 45, if constructed as shown in Figure S28C7d.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Two rows of 64 mm steel studs at 600 mm centres with—

ol.li: an air gap not less than 20 mm between the rows of studs; and
50 mm thick glass wool insulation or 60 mm thick polyester insulation with a density of 11 kg/m³ positioned between one row of studs; and
two layers of 13 mm fire-protective grade plasterboard or one layer of 6 mm fibre-cement sheet and one layer of 13 mm fire-protective grade plasterboard, fixed to outside face of studs,

subclause.p: has an Rw + Ctr of not less than 50 and an Rw of not less than 50, if constructed as shown in Figure S28C7e.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Two rows of 64 mm steel studs at 600 mm centres with—

ol.li: an air gap not less than 80 mm between the rows of studs; and
200 mm thick polyester insulation with a density of 14 kg/m3 positioned between studs; and
one layer of 13 mm fire-protective grade plasterboard and one layer 13 mm plasterboard on one outside face and one layer of 13 mm fire-protective grade plasterboard on the other outside face,

subclause.p: has an Rw + Ctr of not less than 50 and an Rw of not less than 50, if constructed as shown in Figure S28C7f.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: One row of 92 mm steel studs at 600 mm centres with—

ol.li: 50 mm thick glass wool insulation with a density of 11 kg/m3 or 60 mm thick polyester insulation with a density of 8 kg/m3, positioned between studs; and
two layers of 13 mm fire-protective grade plasterboard or one layer of 6 mm fibre-cement sheet and one layer of 13 mm fire-protective grade plasterboard, fixed to each face,

subclause.p: has an Rw of not less than 50, if constructed as shown in Figure S28C7g.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: One row of 64 mm steel studs with 2 layers of 16 mm fire-protective grade plasterboard fixed to each face has an Rw of not less than 45, if constructed as shown in Figure S28C7h.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: One row of 64 mm steel studs with—

ol.li: one layer of 16 mm fire-protective grade plasterboard fixed to one face; and
50 mm thick glass or mineral wool insulation with a density of 11 kg/m3 positioned between the studs; and
two layers of fire-protective grade plasterboard fixed to the other face, the inner layer being 16 mm thick and the outer layer being 13 mm,

subclause.p: has an Rw of not less than 45, if constructed as shown in Figure S28C7i.

subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: One row of 64 mm steel studs with two layers of 13 mm plasterboard on each face has an Rw of not less than 45, if constructed as shown in Figure S28C7j.
